CGS.H

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 //*****************************************************************
00002 // Iterative template routine -- CGS
00003 //
00004 // CGS solves the unsymmetric linear system Ax = b 
00005 // using the Conjugate Gradient Squared method
00006 //
00007 // CGS follows the algorithm described on p. 26 of the 
00008 // SIAM Templates book.
00009 //
00010 // The return value indicates convergence within max_iter (input)
00011 // iterations (0), or no convergence within max_iter iterations (1).
00012 //
00013 // Upon successful return, output arguments have the following values:
00014 //  
00015 //        x  --  approximate solution to Ax = b
00016 // max_iter  --  the number of iterations performed before the
00017 //               tolerance was reached
00018 //      tol  --  the residual after the final iteration
00019 //  
00020 //*****************************************************************
00021 
00022 template < class Matrix, class Vector, class Preconditioner, class Real >
00023 int 
00024 CGS(const Matrix &A, Vector &x, const Vector &b,
00025     const Preconditioner &M, int &max_iter, Real &tol)
00026 {
00027   Real resid;
00028   Vector rho_1(1), rho_2(1), alpha(1), beta(1);
00029   Vector p, phat, q, qhat, vhat, u, uhat;
00030 
00031   Real normb = norm(b);
00032   Vector r = b - A*x;
00033   Vector rtilde = r;
00034 
00035   if (normb == 0.0)
00036     normb = 1;
00037   
00038   if ((resid = norm(r) / normb) <= tol) {
00039     tol = resid;
00040     max_iter = 0;
00041     return 0;
00042   }
00043 
00044   for (int i = 1; i <= max_iter; i++) {
00045     rho_1(0) = dot(rtilde, r);
00046     if (rho_1(0) == 0) {
00047       tol = norm(r) / normb;
00048       return 2;
00049     }
00050     if (i == 1) {
00051       u = r;
00052       p = u;
00053     } else {
00054       beta(0) = rho_1(0) / rho_2(0);
00055       u = r + beta(0) * q;
00056       p = u + beta(0) * (q + beta(0) * p);
00057     }
00058     phat = M.solve(p);
00059     vhat = A*phat;
00060     alpha(0) = rho_1(0) / dot(rtilde, vhat);
00061     q = u - alpha(0) * vhat;
00062     uhat = M.solve(u + q);
00063     x += alpha(0) * uhat;
00064     qhat = A * uhat;
00065     r -= alpha(0) * qhat;
00066     rho_2(0) = rho_1(0);
00067     if ((resid = norm(r) / normb) < tol) {
00068       tol = resid;
00069       max_iter = i;
00070       return 0;
00071     }
00072   }
00073   
00074   tol = resid;
00075   return 1;
00076 }
